pros: Morgan Stanley is among one of the best Investment Banks on the street. Not only it has a great work environment, the management takes the time and effort to cultivate the people in the firm. Everyone is very professional and work as a team.
cons: There isn't really much negative about the firm.

pros: Work Life balance, volunteering opportunities,

advice_to_mgmt: hire people who know what they are doing in critical areas, not people with no experience

pros: Great people, firm reputation is strong. A lot of people to learn from.
cons: Underpaid and tough work environment

review_title: Fast Paced, Low Pay, Lousy Training
pros:
- 20 days of vacation, 7 sick days
- Nice view from the office and nice area to take a walk in
- Good name on resume
cons:
- Must take 10 consecutive vacation days at a time
- Pay is very low. Everybody is underpaid. MS doesn't even reimburse for expensive parking.
- Too many temps utilized
- High attrition rates and reorganization of teams
- Training is pathetic for such a high stakes job. Very hard to get a high level view of the business when there are so many buttons to click and NY constantly chasing you.
- No work events (no holiday parties, on-site events, team building activities)
- The facilities themselves are terrible. Restrooms don't have soap.
advice_to_mgmt: Pay a higher salary, train better. HR needs to stop misleading people.

pros: Flexible schuelde and 2 wks PTO

pros: Work life balance is great.

review_title: Great company to work with. Management needs some help!!
pros: A positive environment to work in. Excellent learning opportunity!
cons: Very poorly managed! Extremely politically biasedly run!
advice_to_mgmt: Don't give up on someone after JUST ONE PHONE CALL!! Give the employee an opportunity to learn from every call, not just the bad ones!!

pros: Good benefits , Salary , Vacation and perks

pros: Great benefits ( medical, financial, legal and leisure), Volunteer opportunities, Salary based on experience however that depends on the group you are working for. Great people to work with.

review_title: Pretty standard corporate office, not great, not awful
pros: Good benefits, community involvement, good co-workers.
cons: Never give more than the standard 1-2% raise, detached from HQ in NY, open office floor plan is tightly packed (zero privacy and very loud atmosphere)

review_title: Great Place to Get a Start in Finance
pros:
Great deal flow - awesome for exposure
Good training and technical skills
Internal mobility is a focus if you are a top performer. There are designated programs
Nice facilities and especially basement gym
CEO has a reasonable, balanced approach to the industry
cons:
Lots of long hours (not different from other IB shops)
Bonuses are not particularly good compared to street

pros: hours are good; healthcare options are average
cons: management is rough at certain branches and the firm relies heavily on your team to match compensation. you could easily make far less than your peers if you are stuck on a stingy team. management also has freedom to move you among teams without your consultation. very high turnover
